bioghist.p: Angeline Helen Lograsso (1896-1981) received her bachelor's and master's degrees from the University of Rochester, where she taught from 1917 to 1930. In 1927 she received her Ph.D. from Radcliffe. Lograsso was Professor Emeritus of Italian at Bryn Mawr College, where she taught from 1930 to 1965, serving as chairman of the Italian department from 1952 until her retirement.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Angeline Lograsso. Materials include correspondence with colleagues, students, politicians, and news organizations (1930s-1970s); correspondence between Lograsso and Don Luigi Sturzo (1942-1950s); notes and manuscripts for articles on Don Luigi Sturzo, Byron, Dante, and others; translations of Sturzo's writings; clippings and reviews; and published editions of Sturzo's works.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
